meanings.definition: Pointing again or anew, as the filling in of joints in masonry with fresh mortar.
meanings.sent1: The workers were repointing the old brick wall to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: My dad is repointing the chimney to prevent water leaks.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought repointing the wall was a fun game with the falling mortar.
meanings.sent4: The artist repointed the colors on the canvas to bring life to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The sun repoints its rays towards the earth, warming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To repair the mortar joints of (a brick wall, etc.).
meanings.sent1: We need to repoint the garden wall before winter comes.
meanings.sent2: The mason is repointing the historic building to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be tiny builders, repointing the Lego castle.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a skilled hand repointing the cracks in their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully repoints the layers of the cake with delicious frosting.
